method.description: Waits on an IPC event from Steam sent when there is new data to be fetched from the data drop. Returns true when data was recievied before the timeout expires. Useful for games with a dedicated input thread.

method.name: writeScreenshot
method.description: Writes a screenshot to the user's Steam screenshot library.

signal.name: active_beacons_updated
signal.description: Notification that the list of active beacons visible to the current user has changed.

signal.name: add_app_dependency_result
signal.description: The result of a call to [method Steam.addAppDependency].

signal.name: add_ugc_dependency_result
signal.description: The result of a call to [method Steam.addAppDependency].

signal.name: app_installed
signal.description: Sent when a new app is installed.

signal.name: app_resuming_from_suspend
signal.description: Sent after the device returns from sleep/suspend mode.

signal.name: app_uninstalled
signal.description: Sent when an app is uninstalled.

signal.name: available_beacon_locations_updated
signal.description: Notification that the list of available locations for posting a beacon has been updated.

signal.name: avatar_image_loaded
signal.description: Called when an avatar is requested; sends back the raw Steamworks callback data compared to [signal Steam.avatar_loaded]. Emits signal in response to function [method Steam.getLargeFriendAvatar], [method Steam.getMediumFriendAvatar], or [method Steam.getSmallFriendAvatar].

signal.name: avatar_loaded
signal.description: Called when a large avatar is loaded if you have tried requesting it when it was unavailable. Emits signal in response to function [method Steam.getLargeFriendAvatar], [method Steam.getMediumFriendAvatar], or [method Steam.getSmallFriendAvatar].

signal.name: change_num_open_slots
signal.description: Call result for [method Steam.changeNumOpenSlots].

signal.name: change_server_requested
signal.description: This callback is made when joining a game. If the user is attempting to join a lobby, then the callback [signal Steam.join_requested] will be made.

signal.name: check_file_signature
signal.description: Call result for [method Steam.checkFileSignature].

signal.name: clan_activity_downloaded
signal.description: Called when a Steam group activity has received. Emits signal in response to function [method Steam.downloadClanActivityCounts].

signal.name: client_game_server_deny
signal.description: Sent by the Steam server to the client telling it to disconnect from the specified game server, which it may be in the process of or already connected to. The game client should immediately disconnect upon receiving this message. This can usually occur if the user doesn't have rights to play on the game server.

signal.name: connected_chat_join
signal.description: Called when a user has joined a Steam group chat that the we are in.

signal.name: connected_chat_leave
signal.description: Called when a user has left a Steam group chat that the we are in.

signal.name: connected_clan_chat_message
signal.description: Called when a chat message has been received in a Steam group chat that we are in. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴ret (int) ┠╴text (string) ┠╴type (string) ┖╴chatter (int) [/codeblock]

signal.name: connected_friend_chat_message
signal.description: Called when chat message has been received from a friend. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴ret (int) ┠╴text (string) ┖╴type (int) [/codeblock]

signal.name: create_beacon
signal.description: This callback is used as a call response for [method Steam.createBeacon]. If successful, your beacon has been posted in the desired location and you may start receiving [signal Steam.reservation_notification] callbacks for users following the beacon.

signal.name: current_stats_received
signal.description: Called when the latest stats and achievements for the local user have been received from the server; in response to function [method Steam.requestCurrentStats]

signal.name: dlc_installed
signal.description: Triggered after the current user gains ownership of DLC and that DLC is installed.

signal.name: download_ugc_result
signal.description: Response when downloading UGC. The returned dictionary has the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴handle (int) ┠╴app_id (int) ┠╴size (int) ┠╴filename (string) ┖╴owner_id (int) [/codeblock]

signal.name: duration_control
signal.description: Sent for games with enabled anti indulgence / duration control, for enabled users. Lets the game know whether persistent rewards or XP should be granted at normal rate, half rate, or zero rate. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴app_id (int) ┠╴applicable (bool) ┠╴seconds_last_5hrs (int) ┠╴progress (int) ┠╴notification (int) ┖╴notification_verbal (string) [/codeblock]

signal.name: encrypted_app_ticket_response
signal.description: Called when an encrypted application ticket has been received.

signal.name: end_game_result
signal.description: This callback confirms that the game is recorded as complete on the matchmaking service, the next call to [method Steam.requestPlayersForGame] will generate a new unique game ID.

signal.name: enumerate_following_list
signal.description: Returns the result of [method Steam.enumerateFollowingList]. The returned array contains a list of dictionaries containing the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴num (int) ┖╴id (int) [/codeblock]

signal.name: equipped_profile_items
signal.description: Call result from [method Steam.requestEquippedProfileItems]. Also sent as a callback. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴avatar_animated (bool) ┠╴avatar_frame (bool) ┠╴profile_modifier (bool) ┠╴profile_background (bool) ┖╴profile_mini_background (bool) [/codeblock]

signal.name: equipped_profile_items_changed
signal.description: Callback for when a user's equipped Steam Commuity profile items have changed. This can be for the current user or their friends.

signal.name: fake_ip_result
signal.description: A struct used to describe a "fake IP" we have been assigned to use as an identifier. This callback is posted when [method Steam.beginAsyncRequestFakeIP]completes.

signal.name: favorites_list_accounts_updated
signal.description: Called when an account on your favorites list is updated.

signal.name: favorites_list_changed
signal.description: A server was added/removed from the favorites list, you should refresh now. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴ip (string) ┠╴query_port (int) ┠╴connection_port (int) ┠╴app_id (int) ┠╴flags (int) ┠╴add (bool) ┖╴account_id (int) [/codeblock]

signal.name: file_details_result
signal.description: Called after requesting the details of a specific file.

signal.name: file_read_async_complete
signal.description: Response when reading a file with [method Steam.fileReadAsync].

signal.name: file_share_result
signal.description: Response to a file being shared.

signal.name: file_write_async_complete
signal.description: Response when writing a file asyncrounously with [method Steam.fileWriteAsync].

signal.name: filter_text_dictionary_changed
signal.description: Sent when the text filtering dictionary has changed languages.

signal.name: floating_gamepad_text_input_dismissed
signal.description: Called when the floating keyboard invoked from [method Steam.showFloatingGamepadTextInput] has been closed.

signal.name: friend_rich_presence_update
signal.description: Called when rich presence data has been updated for a user, this can happen automatically when friends in the same game update their rich presence, or after a call to [method Steam.requestFriendRichPresence].

signal.name: game_web_callback
signal.description: Sent to your game in response to a [code]steam://gamewebcallback/[/code] command from a user clicking a link in the Steam overlay browser. You can use this to add support for external site signups where you want to pop back into the browser after some web page signup sequence, and optionally get back some detail about that.

signal.name: gamepad_text_input_dismissed
signal.description: Called when the Big Picture gamepad text input has been closed.

signal.name: get_app_dependencies_result
signal.description: Called when getting the app dependencies for an item.

signal.name: get_auth_session_ticket_response
signal.description: Result when creating an auth session ticket.

signal.name: get_follower_count
signal.description: Returns the result of [method Steam.getFollowerCount].

signal.name: get_item_vote_result
signal.description: Called when getting the users vote status on an item.

signal.name: get_opf_settings_result
signal.description: Triggered when the OPF Details for 360 video playback are retrieved. After receiving this you can use [method Steam.getOPFStringForApp] to access the OPF details.

signal.name: get_ticket_for_web_api
signal.description: Result when creating an web API ticket from GetAuthTicketForWebApi.

signal.name: get_video_result
signal.description: Provides the result of a call to [method Steam.getVideoURL].

signal.name: global_achievement_percentages_ready
signal.description: Called when the global achievement percentages have been received from the server.

signal.name: global_stats_received
signal.description: Called when the global stats have been received from the server.

signal.name: html_browser_ready
signal.description: A new browser was created and is ready for use.

signal.name: html_can_go_backandforward
signal.description: Called when page history status has changed the ability to go backwards and forward.

signal.name: html_changed_title
signal.description: Called when the current page in a browser gets a new title.

signal.name: html_close_browser
signal.description: Called when the browser has been requested to close due to user interaction; usually because of a javascript window.close() call.

signal.name: html_file_open_dialog
signal.description: Called when a browser surface has received a file open dialog from a [code]input type="file"[/code] click or similar, you must call [method Steam.fileLoadDialogResponse] with the file(s) the user selected.

signal.name: html_finished_request
signal.description: Called when a browser has finished loading a page.

signal.name: html_hide_tooltip
signal.description: Called when a a browser wants to hide a tooltip.

signal.name: html_horizontal_scroll
signal.description: Provides details on the visibility and size of the horizontal scrollbar. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴scroll_max (int) ┠╴scroll_current (int) ┠╴page_scale (float) ┠╴visible (bool) ┖╴page_size (int) [/codeblock]

signal.name: html_js_alert
signal.description: Called when the browser wants to display a Javascript alert dialog, call [method Steam.jsDialogResponse] when the user dismisses this dialog; or right away to ignore it.

signal.name: html_js_confirm
signal.description: Called when the browser wants to display a Javascript confirmation dialog, call [method Steam.jsDialogResponse] when the user dismisses this dialog; or right away to ignore it.

signal.name: html_link_at_position
signal.description: Result of a call to [method Steam.getLinkAtPosition].

signal.name: html_needs_paint
signal.description: Called when a browser surface has a pending paint. This is where you get the actual image data to render to the screen. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴bgra (string) ┠╴wide (int) ┠╴tall (int) ┠╴update_x (int) ┠╴update_y (int) ┠╴update_wide (int) ┠╴update_tall (int) ┠╴scroll_x (int) ┠╴scroll_y (int) ┠╴page_scale (float) ┖╴page_serial (int) [/codeblock]

signal.name: html_new_window
signal.description: A browser has created a new HTML window. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴url (string) ┠╴x (int) ┠╴y (int) ┠╴wide (int) ┠╴tall (int) ┖╴new_handle (int) [/codeblock]

signal.name: html_open_link_in_new_tab
signal.description: The browser has requested to load a url in a new tab.

signal.name: html_search_results
signal.description: Results from a search.

signal.name: html_set_cursor
signal.description: Called when a browser wants to change the mouse cursor.

signal.name: html_show_tooltip
signal.description: Called when a browser wants to display a tooltip.

signal.name: html_start_request
signal.description: Called when a browser wants to navigate to a new page.

signal.name: html_status_text
signal.description: Called when a browser wants you to display an informational message. This is most commonly used when you hover over links.

signal.name: html_update_tooltip
signal.description: Called when the text of an existing tooltip has been updated.

signal.name: html_url_changed
signal.description: Called when the browser is navigating to a new url. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴url (string) ┠╴post_data (string) ┠╴redirect (bool) ┠╴title (string) ┖╴new_navigation (bool) [/codeblock]

signal.name: html_vertical_scroll
signal.description: Provides details on the visibility and size of the vertical scrollbar. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴scroll_max (int) ┠╴scroll_current (int) ┠╴page_scale (float) ┠╴visible (bool) ┖╴page_size (int) [/codeblock]

signal.name: http_request_completed
signal.description: Result when an HTTP request completes. If you're using [method Steam.getHTTPStreamingResponseBodyData] then you should be using the [signal Steam.http_request_headers_received] or [signal Steam.http_request_data_received].

signal.name: http_request_data_received
signal.description: Triggered when a chunk of data is received from a streaming HTTP request.

signal.name: http_request_headers_received
signal.description: Triggered when HTTP headers are received from a streaming HTTP request.

signal.name: input_action_event
signal.description: Purpose: when callbacks are enabled this fires each time a controller action state changes.

signal.name: input_configuration_loaded
signal.description: Called when a controller configuration has been loaded, will fire once per controller per focus change for Steam Input enabled controllers. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴mapping_creator (int) ┠╴major_revision (int) ┠╴minor_revision (int) ┠╴uses_steam_input_api (bool) ┖╴uses_gamepad_api (bool) [/codeblock]

signal.name: input_device_connected
signal.description: Called when a new controller has been connected, will fire once per controller if multiple new controllers connect in the same frame.

signal.name: input_device_disconnected
signal.description: Called when a new controller has been connected, will fire once per controller if multiple new controllers connect in the same frame.

signal.name: input_gamepad_slot_change
signal.description: Called when controller gamepad slots change. On Linux / macOS these slots are shared for all running apps.

signal.name: inventory_definition_update
signal.description: This callback is triggered whenever item definitions have been updated, which could be in response to [method Steam.loadItemDefinitions] or any time new item definitions are available (eg, from the dynamic addition of new item types while players are still in-game).

signal.name: inventory_eligible_promo_item
signal.description: Returned when you have requested the list of "eligible" promo items that can be manually granted to the given user. These are promo items of type "manual" that won't be granted automatically.

signal.name: inventory_full_update
signal.description: Triggered when [method Steam.getAllItems] successfully returns a result which is newer / fresher than the last known result. (It will not trigger if the inventory hasn't changed, or if results from two overlapping calls are reversed in flight and the earlier result is already known to be stale/out-of-date.) The regular [method Steam.inventory_result_ready] callback will still be triggered immediately afterwards; this is an additional notification for your convenience.

signal.name: inventory_request_prices_result
signal.description: Returned after [method Steam.requestPrices] is called.

signal.name: inventory_start_purchase_result
signal.description: This is fired whenever an inventory result transitions from k_EResultPending to any other completed state, see [method Steam.getResultStatus] for the complete list of states. There will always be exactly one callback per handle.

signal.name: ip_country
signal.description: Called when the country of the user changed. The country should be updated with [method Steam.getIPCountry].

signal.name: ipc_failure
signal.description: Called when the callback system for this client is in an error state (and has flushed pending callbacks). When getting this message the client should disconnect from Steam, reset any stored Steam state and reconnect. This usually occurs in the rare event the Steam client has some kind of fatal error.

signal.name: is_following
signal.description: Returns the result of [method Steam.isFollowing].

signal.name: item_created
signal.description: Called when a new workshop item has been created.

signal.name: item_deleted
signal.description: Called when an attempt at deleting an item completes.

signal.name: item_downloaded
signal.description: Called when a workshop item has been downloaded.

signal.name: item_installed
signal.description: Called when a workshop item has been installed or updated.

signal.name: item_updated
signal.description: Called when an item update has completed. Emits signal in response to function [method Steam.submitItemUpdate].

signal.name: join_clan_chat_complete
signal.description: Posted when the user has attempted to join a Steam group chat via [method Steam.joinClanChatRoom].

signal.name: join_game_requested
signal.description: Called when the user tries to join a game from their friends list or after a user accepts an invite by a friend with [method Steam.inviteUserToGame]. Emits signal in response to receiving a Steam invite.

signal.name: join_party
signal.description: This callback is used as a call response for [method Steam.joinParty]. On success, you will have reserved a slot in the beacon-owner's party, and should use connect_string to connect to their game and complete the process.

signal.name: join_requested
signal.description: Called when the user tries to join a lobby from their friends list or after a user accepts an invite by a friend with [method Steam.inviteUserToGame]. Emits signal in response to receiving a Steam invite.

signal.name: leaderboard_find_result
signal.description: Result when finding a leaderboard.

signal.name: leaderboard_score_uploaded
signal.description: Result indicating that a leaderboard score has been uploaded. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴score (int) ┠╴score_changed (int) ┠╴global_rank_new (int) ┖╴global_rank_prev (int) [/codeblock]

signal.name: leaderboard_scores_downloaded
signal.description: Called when scores for a leaderboard have been downloaded and are ready to be retrieved. The returned array contains dictionaries containing the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴score (int) ┠╴steam_id (int) ┠╴global_rank (int) ┠╴ugc_handle (int) ┖╴details (array) [/codeblock]

signal.name: leaderboard_ugc_set
signal.description: Result indicating that user generated content has been attached to one of the current user's leaderboard entries.

signal.name: licenses_updated
signal.description: Called whenever the users licenses (owned packages) changes.

signal.name: lobby_chat_update
signal.description: A lobby chat room state has changed, this is usually sent when a user has joined or left the lobby.

signal.name: lobby_created
signal.description: Result of our request to create a Lobby. At this point, the lobby has been joined and is ready for use.

signal.name: lobby_data_update
signal.description: The lobby metadata has changed.

signal.name: lobby_game_created
signal.description: A game server has been set via [method Steam.setLobbyGameServer] for all of the members of the lobby to join. It's up to the individual clients to take action on this; the typical game behavior is to leave the lobby and connect to the specified game server; but the lobby may stay open throughout the session if desired.

signal.name: lobby_invite
signal.description: Someone has invited you to join a lobby. Normally you don't need to do anything with this, as the Steam UI will also display a 'user has invited you to the lobby, join?' notification and message.

signal.name: lobby_joined
signal.description: Received upon attempting to enter a lobby. Lobby metadata is available to use immediately after receiving this.

signal.name: lobby_kicked
signal.description: Posted if a user is forcefully removed from a lobby; can occur if a user loses connection to Steam.

signal.name: lobby_match_list
signal.description: Result when requesting the lobby list. Emits signal in response to function [method Steam.requestLobbyList].

signal.name: lobby_message
signal.description: A chat (text or binary) message for this lobby has been received.

signal.name: local_file_changed
signal.description: One or more files for this app have changed locally after syncing to remote session changes. [b]Note:[/b] only posted if this happens during the local app session.

signal.name: low_power
signal.description: Called when running on a laptop and less than 10 minutes of battery is left, and then fires then every minute afterwards.

signal.name: microtransaction_auth_response
signal.description: Called when a user has responded to a microtransaction authorization request.

signal.name: music_playback_status_has_changed
signal.description: There are no notes in the Steamworks documentation.

signal.name: music_player_remote_to_front
signal.description: There are no notes in the Steamworks documentation.

signal.name: music_player_remote_will_activate
signal.description: There are no notes in the Steamworks documentation.

signal.name: music_player_remote_will_deactivate
signal.description: There are no notes in the Steamworks documentation.

signal.name: music_player_selects_playlist_entry
signal.description: There are no notes in the Steamworks documentation.

signal.name: music_player_selects_queue_entry
signal.description: There are no notes in the Steamworks documentation.

signal.name: music_player_wants_looped
signal.description: There are no notes in the Steamworks documentation.

signal.name: music_player_wants_pause
signal.description: There are no notes in the Steamworks documentation.

signal.name: music_player_wants_play
signal.description: There are no notes in the Steamworks documentation.

signal.name: music_player_wants_play_next
signal.description: There are no notes in the Steamworks documentation.

signal.name: music_player_wants_play_previous
signal.description: There are no notes in the Steamworks documentation.

signal.name: music_player_wants_playing_repeat_status
signal.description: There are no notes in the Steamworks documentation.

signal.name: music_player_wants_shuffled
signal.description: There are no notes in the Steamworks documentation.

signal.name: music_player_wants_volume
signal.description: There are no notes in the Steamworks documentation.

signal.name: music_player_will_quit
signal.description: There are no notes in the Steamworks documentation.

signal.name: music_volume_has_changed
signal.description: There are no notes in the Steamworks documentation.

signal.name: name_changed
signal.description: Reports the result of an attempt to change the current user's persona name. Emits signal in response to function [method Steam.setPersonaName].

signal.name: network_authentication_status
signal.description: This callback is posted whenever the state of our readiness changes.

signal.name: network_connection_status_changed
signal.description: This callback is posted whenever a connection is created, destroyed, or changes state. The m_info field will contain a complete description of the connection at the time the change occurred and the callback was posted. In particular, m_info.m_eState will have the new connection state. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴identity (string) ┠╴user_data (int) ┠╴listen_socket (int) ┠╴remote_address (string) ┠╴remote_pop (int) ┠╴pop_relay (int) ┠╴connection_state (int) ┠╴end_reason (string) ┠╴end_debug (string) ┖╴debug_description (string) [/codeblock]

signal.name: network_messages_session_failed
signal.description: Posted when we fail to establish a connection, or we detect that communications have been disrupted it an unusual way.

signal.name: network_messages_session_request
signal.description: Posted when a remote host is sending us a message, and we do not already have a session with them.

signal.name: new_launch_url_parameters
signal.description: Triggered after the user executes a steam url with command line or query parameters such as [code]steam://run/(app_id)//?param1=value1;param2=value2;param3=value3;[/code] while the game is already running. The new params can be queried with [method Steam.getLaunchCommandLine] and [method Steam.getLaunchQueryParam].

signal.name: number_of_current_players
signal.description: Gets the current number of players for the current app ID.

signal.name: overlay_browser_protocol
signal.description: Dispatched when an overlay browser instance is navigated to a protocol/scheme registered by [method Steam.registerProtocolInOverlayBrowser].

signal.name: overlay_toggled
signal.description: Posted when the Steam Overlay activates or deactivates. The game can use this to be pause or resume single player games.

signal.name: p2p_session_connect_fail
signal.description: Called when a user sends a packet and it fails.

signal.name: p2p_session_request
signal.description: Called when a user sends a packet.

signal.name: parental_setting_changed
signal.description: Callback for querying UGC.

signal.name: persona_state_change
signal.description: This is called when a user has some kind of change.

signal.name: ping_server_failed_to_respond
signal.description: The server has failed to respond to a ping request.

signal.name: ping_server_responded
signal.description: The server has responded to a ping request. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴name (string) ┠╴connection_address (string) ┠╴query_address (string) ┠╴ping (int) ┠╴success_response (bool) ┠╴no_refresh (bool) ┠╴game_dir (string) ┠╴map (string) ┠╴description (string) ┠╴app_id (int) ┠╴players (int) ┠╴max_players (int) ┠╴bot_players (int) ┠╴password (bool) ┠╴secure (bool) ┠╴last_played (int) ┠╴server_version (int) ┠╴game_tags (string) ┖╴steam_id (uint64_t) [/codeblock]

signal.name: player_details_failed_to_respond
signal.description: The server failed to respond to a player details request.

signal.name: player_details_player_added
signal.description: The server has responded to a player details request.

signal.name: player_details_refresh_complete
signal.description: The server has completed a player details request.

signal.name: relay_network_status
signal.description: A struct used to describe our readiness to use the relay network.

signal.name: remote_play_session_connected
signal.description: Called when a player connects to a remote play session.

signal.name: remote_play_session_disconnected
signal.description: Called when a player disconnects from a remote play session.

signal.name: remove_app_dependency_result
signal.description: Purpose: The result of a call to [method Steam.removeAppDependency].

signal.name: remove_ugc_dependency_result
signal.description: Purpose: The result of a call to [method Steam.removeDependency].

signal.name: request_clan_officer_list
signal.description: Marks the return of a request officer list call. Emits signal in response to function [method Steam.requestClanOfficerList]. The returned list contains dictionaries which contain the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴id (int) ┖╴name (string) [/codeblock]

signal.name: request_players_for_game_final_result
signal.description: There are no notes about this in Valve's header files or documentation.

signal.name: request_players_for_game_progress
signal.description: Callback from [method Steam.requestPlayersForGame] when the matchmaking service has started or ended search; callback will also follow a call from [method Steam.cancelRequestPlayersForGame] - search_in_progress will be false.

signal.name: request_players_for_game_result
signal.description: Callback from [method Steam.requestPlayersForGame], one of these will be sent per player followed by additional callbacks when players accept or decline the game. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴player_id (int) ┠╴lobby_id (int) ┠╴player_accept_state (int) ┠╴player_index (int) ┠╴total_players (int) ┠╴total_players_accepted_game (int) ┠╴suggested_team_index (int) ┖╴unique_game_id (int) [/codeblock]

signal.name: request_server_list_refresh_complete
signal.description: A server list request has completed.

signal.name: request_server_list_server_failed_to_respond
signal.description: A server failed to respond to a list request.

signal.name: request_server_list_server_responded
signal.description: A server has responded to a list request.

signal.name: reservation_notification
signal.description: After creating a beacon, when a user "follows" that beacon Steam will send you this callback to know that you should be prepared for the user to join your game. When they do join, be sure to call [method Steam.onReservationCompleted] to let Steam know.

signal.name: screenshot_ready
signal.description: A screenshot successfully written or otherwise added to the library and can now be tagged.

signal.name: screenshot_requested
signal.description: A screenshot has been requested by the user from the Steam screenshot hotkey. This will only be called if [method Steam.hookScreenshots] has been enabled, in which case Steam will not take the screenshot itself.

signal.name: search_for_game_progress
signal.description: There are no notes about this in Valve's header files or documentation. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴lobby_id (int) ┠╴ended_search_id (int) ┠╴seconds_remaining_estimate (int) ┖╴players_searching (int) [/codeblock]

signal.name: search_for_game_result
signal.description: Notification to all players searching that a game has been found. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴count_players_ingame (int) ┠╴count_accepted_game (int) ┠╴host_id (int) ┖╴final_callback (bool) [/codeblock]

signal.name: server_connect_failure
signal.description: Called when a connection attempt has failed. This will occur periodically if the Steam client is not connected, and has failed when retrying to establish a connection.

signal.name: server_rules_failed_to_respond
signal.description: The server failed to respond with a rules request.

signal.name: server_rules_refresh_complete
signal.description: The server has completed a rules refresh.

signal.name: server_rules_responded
signal.description: The server responded with a rules request.

signal.name: set_user_item_vote
signal.description: Called when the user has voted on an item.

signal.name: start_playtime_tracking
signal.description: Called when workshop item playtime tracking has started.

signal.name: steam_api_call_completed
signal.description: Called when a SteamAPICall_t has completed or failed.

signal.name: steam_server_connect_failed
signal.description: Called when a connection attempt has failed. This will occur periodically if the Steam client is not connected, and has failed when retrying to establish a connection.

signal.name: steam_server_connected
signal.description: Called when a connections to the Steam back-end has been established. This means the Steam client now has a working connection to the Steam servers. Usually this will have occurred before the game has launched, and should only be seen if the user has dropped connection due to a networking issue or a Steam server update.

signal.name: steam_server_disconnected
signal.description: Called if the client has lost connection to the Steam servers. Real-time services will be disabled until a matching [signal Steam.steam_server_connected] has been posted.

signal.name: steam_shutdown
signal.description: Called when Steam wants to shut down.

signal.name: steamworks_error
signal.description: Intended to serve as generic error messaging for failed call results.

signal.name: stop_playtime_tracking
signal.description: Called when workshop item playtime tracking has stopped.

signal.name: store_auth_url_response
signal.description: Response when we have recieved the authentication URL after a call to [method Steam.requestStoreAuthURL].

signal.name: submit_player_result
signal.description: This callback confirms that results were received by the matchmaking service for this player.

signal.name: subscribe_item
signal.description: Called when a player attempts to subscribe to a Workshop item. [b]Deprecated:[/b] only used with the deprecated Remote Storage based Workshop API.

signal.name: timed_trial_status
signal.description: Called for games in Timed Trial mode.

signal.name: ugc_query_completed
signal.description: Called when a UGC query request completes.

signal.name: unread_chat_messages_changed
signal.description: Invoked when the status of unread messages changes

signal.name: unsubscribe_item
signal.description: Called when a player attempts to unsubscribe from a Workshop item. [b]Deprecated:[/b] only used with the deprecated Remote Storage based Workshop API.

signal.name: user_achievement_icon_fetched
signal.description: Result of an achievement icon that has been fetched.

signal.name: user_achievement_stored
signal.description: Result of a request to store the achievements on the server, or an "indicate progress" call. If both current progress and max progress are zero, that means the achievement has been fully unlocked.

signal.name: user_favorite_items_list_changed
signal.description: Called when the user has added or removed an item to/from their favorites.

signal.name: user_stats_received
signal.description: Called when the latest stats and achievements for a specific user (including the local user) have been received from the server.

signal.name: user_stats_stored
signal.description: Result of a request to store the user stats.

signal.name: user_stats_unloaded
signal.description: Callback indicating that a user's stats have been unloaded. Call [method Steam.requestUserStats] again before accessing stats for this user.

signal.name: user_subscribed_items_list_changed
signal.description: Signal that the list of subscribed items changed.

signal.name: validate_auth_ticket_response
signal.description: Called when an auth ticket has been validated. Emits signal in response to function [method Steam.beginAuthSession].

signal.name: workshop_eula_status
signal.description: Status of the user's acceptable/rejection of the app's specific Workshop EULA. The returned dictionary contains the following keys: [codeblock] ┠╴version (int) ┠╴action (int) ┠╴accepted (bool) ┖╴needs_action (bool) [/codeblock]
